description: Enhancing Livelihood Opportunities and Building Social capital for New Livelihood Strategies in Darfur.

subproject.corporate outcome: National and local institutions have the capacity to deliver improved justice and security, including safeguarding citizen security, in conflict-affected settings
subproject.description:
Darfur Livelihoods project was developed under the UNDP Bridging Programme 2007-2008 to contribute to outcome 7:”Livelihoods and community security improved in conflict-affected areas in an environmentally manner”. Under the new Country Programme Action Plan (CPAP) 2009-2012, this outcome has been changed into:”Post-conflict socio-economic infrastructure restored, economy revived and employment generated.”  In the past two year, the Darfur Livelihoods project has been funded under the Darfur Area Focus Action Plan, a funding framework which aimed at advocating for an increase of Early Recovery approach and activities in the three Darfur states.  
Main project objectives and strategy/approach 
In 2011, the project will focus on the following components:
- Development of a Livelihood and Natural Resource Management Platform for an early recovery of economic activities in Darfur; 
- Assess and develop the capacity building of national institutions to undertake livelihood activities 
- Develop early recovery understanding and coordination of UN Agencies in Darfur
donor_long: UNDP AS AA FOR JP PASS THROUGH
Khalifa bn Zayed Al Nehayan Found
